comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Wrote: Thanks for pointing out the presence of the warship! I got a bit carried away  and asked some expertise in order to identify the ships.  After providing some magnified high definition extracts of the photograph this information came up):

The picture depicts major parts of the coast fleet. The large ship is HMS Svea (armored ship of the 1st class) built in 1885-86 at the Lindholmen shipyard in Göteborg, Sweden. There are at least 4 gunboats of the Blenda-class. One of them seen behind Svea might be Disa. (Thanks to Henrik L, Karlstad). /Lars L

comment.author: 97449017@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sweden before 1945, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
